instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Turns on but no backlight. Backlight fuse keeps getting shorted. Replaced fuse, <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7007</TRANSISTOR> at same time but same thing happens.

Should <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> be replaced next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Did you check for short, or improper low value, on backlight rail before applying power?
Check w/ and w/o LCD connected; starting from fuse to LCD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Why didn't you check for a short...lol. Check for short with and without LCD connected as 2informaticos suggested on BKLT output.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
.572 without LCD and 0.0001 with LCD.

Bad LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Either bad LCD connector on the board, bad LCD cable or bad LCD itself.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Found  known good LCD to test with and short is gone but still no backlight. Replaced F7701 again but only 8.5V on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLFET</SIGNAL>. Bad <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>? Board is spotless

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Are you sure to get compatible screen?
Do you get image?
